newsitem.title: JAPAN: Honda shares fall on strong yen.
newsitem.headline: Honda shares fall on strong yen.

text.p: Shares in Honda Motor Co Ltd fell on Wednesday morning, as the yen's strength against the dollar invited profit-taking despite the automaker's record earnings, released on Tuesday, traders said.
At 0057 GMT, the share price was down 60 yen at 3,570, with 1.036 million shares traded.
On Tuesday, Honda said that its profits more than tripled in the last business year to March 31, 1997, as the weaker yen galvanised overseas sales.
Honda's group net profit for the year rose 212.4 percent year-on-year to a record 221.17 billion yen. Its group sales also rose 24.5 percent to a record level.
